sen.j: 若狭湾（わかさわん）は、福井県から京都府にかけての海岸地形を形成する、日本海に深く入り込んでできた湾。
sen.e: Forming the topography of the coast from Fukui Prefecture to Kyoto Prefecture, Wakasa Bay was created by the subsidence of the ground deeply into the Sea of Japan.
sen.cmt: ※「日本海に深く入り込んでできた」の部分につき、セル10も参考にして、「地盤が日本海に深く陥没してできた」の意味にとって訳しています。
sen.e: Forming the topography of the coast from Fukui Prefecture to Kyoto Prefecture, Wakasa Bay was created by the ground subsiding deep into the Sea of Japan.
Forming the topography of the coast from Fukui Prefecture to Kyoto Prefecture, Wakasa Bay was created by the ground subsiding deep into the Sea of Japan.

sen.j: 福井県北部西端の越前岬と京都府北端の経ヶ岬を直線、及び本州の海岸線によって囲んだ海域を指し、2,657 平方キロメートルの面積を有する。
sen.e: Wakasa Bay is the sea area which is surrounded by the coastline from Echizen-misaki Cape (at the western corner in the northern part of Fukui Prefecture) to Kyoga-misaki Cape (at the northern edge of Kyoto Prefecture) and by the straight line on the sea between the two capes above, and the bay is 2,657 square kilometers in area.

Wakasa Bay is the sea area surrounded by the coastline from Echizen-misaki Cape (at the western corner in the northern part of Fukui Prefecture) to Kyoga-misaki Cape (at the northern edge of Kyoto Prefecture) and by the straight line on the sea between the two capes above, and the bay is 2,657 square kilometers in area.

Wakasa Bay is the sea area surrounded by the coastline from Echizen-misaki Cape (at the western corner in the northern part of Fukui Prefecture) to Kyoga-misaki Cape (at the northern edge of Kyoto Prefecture) and by the straight line on the sea between the two capes above, and the bay is 2,657 square kilometers in area.

sen.j: 日本海側では珍しい、大規模なリアス式海岸が特徴である。
sen.e: The characteristic of Wakasa Bay is the large-scale ria coast, which is rarely seen on the coast of Japan Sea.
The characteristic of Wakasa Bay is the large-scale ria coast, which is rarely seen on the coast of Japan Sea.
The characteristic of Wakasa Bay is the large-scale ria coast, which is rarely seen on the coast of Japan Sea.

sen.j: 若狭湾は日本海の大陥没湾で、リアス式海岸が発達している。
sen.e: Wakasa Bay was created by the large-scale subsidence of the ground into the Sea of Japan, having the ria coast.
Wakasa Bay was created by the large-scale subsidence of the ground into the Sea of Japan, resulting in the formation of the ria coast.
Wakasa Bay was created by the large-scale subsidence of the ground into the Sea of Japan, resulting in the formation of the ria coast.

sen.j: 湾内には敦賀湾、美浜湾、小浜湾、舞鶴湾や宮津湾などの支湾が存在し、日本三景の一つである天橋立と、日本三大松原の一つである気比の松原もある。
sen.e: Within Wakasa Bay, there are some branch bays, such as Tsuruga Bay, Mihama Bay, Obama Bay and Miyazu Bay, and there also exist "Amanohashidate" (one of the three most scenic spots in Japan) & "Kehi no Matsubara" (one of the three most scenic pine groves in Japan).

Within Wakasa Bay, there are some branch bays, such as Tsuruga Bay, Mihama Bay, Obama Bay and Miyazu Bay, and there also exist "Amanohashidate" (one of the three most scenic spots in Japan) & "Kehi no Matsubara" (one of the three most scenic pine groves in Japan).

Within Wakasa Bay, there are some branch bays, such as Tsuruga Bay, Mihama Bay, Obama Bay and Miyazu Bay, and there also exist "Amanohashidate" (one of the three most scenic spots in Japan) and "Kehi no Matsubara" (one of the three most scenic pine groves in Japan).

sen.j: その風光明媚な地形は、1955年に笙の川以西の全湾岸周辺にわたり若狭湾国定公園の大部分、1968年に東岸周辺の一部が越前加賀海岸国定公園の一部に指定されていたが、2007年8月3日に若狭湾国定公園のうち由良川以西が分離独立し、大江山などを加えて新たに丹後天橋立大江山国定公園となり、3つの国定公園を有することになった。
sen.e: Because of the beautiful scenery of the topography, the entire coast from Shono-kawa River and westward was designated in 1955 as the major part of Wakasa Bay Quasi-national Park, and a part of the eastern coast was designated in 1968 as a part of Echizen Kaga Coast Quasi-national Park, and in August 3, 2007, the coast from Yura-gawa River and westward was separated from Wakasa Bay Quasi-national Park, and instead, the coast was combined with Oeyama Mountain Range and became Tango-Amanohashidate-Oeyama Quasi-national Park, so there are three quasi-national parks here now.

Due to the beautiful topography, the entire coast from Shono-kawa River and westward was designated in 1955 as a major part of Wakasa Bay Quasi-national Park, and a part of the eastern coast was designated in 1968 as a part of Echizen Kaga Coast Quasi-national Park, and in August 3, 2007, the coast from Yura-gawa River and westward was separated from Wakasa Bay Quasi-national Park, and instead, the coast was combined with Oeyama Mountain Range and became Tango-Amanohashidate-Oeyama Quasi-national Park, so there are three quasi-national parks here now.

Due to the beautiful topography, the entire coast from Shono-kawa River and westward was designated in 1955 as a major part of Wakasa Bay Quasi-National Park, and a part of the eastern coast was designated in 1968 as a part of Echizen Kaga Coast Quasi-National Park, and in August 3, 2007, the coast from Yura-gawa River and westward was separated from Wakasa Bay Quasi-national Park, and instead, the coast was combined with Oe-yama Mountain Range and became Tango-Amanohashidate-Oeyama Quasi-National Park, so there are three quasi-national parks here now.

sen.j: 若狭湾に点在する港は古来より良港で、しかも京都にも近いため、鯖（サバ）などの魚介類の水揚げ地（いわゆる鯖街道）とも言われる。
sen.e: Harbors dotted on the coastline facing Wakasa Bay have been good ones from ancient times, and they are situated near Kyoto, so they are said to be the harbors to unload fish and shellfish including the mackerel, and there is so-called "Mackerel Highway" (the highway on which fish and shellfish - especially the mackerel - are transported) between Wakasa area and Kyoto.
sen.cmt: ※「鯖街道」の解説部分は、「若狭地方から京都に鯖を中心とする魚介類を運ぶ街道」と訳しています（Wiki 「鯖街道」参照）。
sen.e: Harbors dotting the coastline facing Wakasa Bay have been good ones since ancient times, and are situated near Kyoto, so they are said to be the harbors to unload fish and shellfish including the mackerel. There is also the so-called "Mackerel Highway" (the highway on which fish and shellfish - especially the mackerel - are transported) between Wakasa area and Kyoto.

Harbors dotting the coastline facing Wakasa Bay have been good ones since ancient times, and are situated near Kyoto, so they are said to be the harbors to unload fish and shellfish including mackerel; here is also the so-called "Mackerel Highway" (the highway on which fish and shellfish - especially the mackerel - are transported) between Wakasa area and Kyoto.

sen.j: 日露戦争当時、日本海軍はロシア海軍が本土に上陸する地点は若狭湾であると想定し、京都への侵攻を防ぐため舞鶴に海軍基地、舞鶴から高浜町にかけての海岸沿いには砲台を設置した。
sen.e: Before the Russo-Japanese War, the Imperial Japanese Navy assumed that the landing point of the Russian Navy must be Wakasa Bay, so they established the naval base in Maizuru and gun batteries along the coast from Maizuru to Takahama-cho.

Before the Russo-Japanese War, the Imperial Japanese Navy assumed that the landing point of the Russian Navy would be Wakasa Bay, so they established a naval base in Maizuru and gun batteries along the coast from Maizuru to Takahama-cho.

Before the Russo-Japanese War, the Imperial Japanese Navy assumed that the landing point of the Russian Navy would be Wakasa Bay, so they established a naval base in Maizuru and gun batteries along the coast from Maizuru to Takahama-cho.

sen.j: 現在、夏季には近畿方面からの海水浴利用で賑わいを見せ、また、それ以外の季節は釣り客が訪れる。
sen.e: At present, the bay is crowded with swimmers from Kinki Region during the summer season, and anglers visit here in the other seasons.
At present, the bay is crowded with swimmers from the Kinki Region during the summer, and anglers visit here during other seasons.
At present, the bay is crowded with swimmers from the Kinki region during the summer, and anglers visit here during other seasons.
sen.cmt: region 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 近年では、関西電力によって電源地として開発されており、原子力発電所が多く立地しているため「原発銀座」として有名である。
sen.e: In recent years, the coastal area has been developed as the land of the electric power supply by the Kansai Electric Power Co., Inc, and the area is well-known for "Genpatsu Ginza" (an area where a string of nuclear power plants are located).

In recent years, the coastal area has been developed as the land for electric power supply by the Kansai Electric Power Co., Inc, and the area is well-known for "Genpatsu Ginza" (an area where a string of nuclear power plants are located).

In recent years, the coastal area has been developed as the land for electric power supply by the Kansai Electric Power Co., Inc., and the area is well-known for 'Genpatsu Ginza' (an area where a string of nuclear power plants are located).
sen.cmt: Inc., としました（ピリオド追加）。" →' としました。

sen.j: 他の「原発銀座」には、浜通り（東北地方南部）がある。
sen.e: In southern part of Tohoku Region, there is another "Genpatsu Ginza," that is, Hamadori District.
In the southern part of Tohoku Region, there is another "Genpatsu Ginza," that is, Hamadori District.
In the southern part of Tohoku region, there is another 'Genpatsu Ginza,' that is, Hamadori District.

sen.j: 以下の5市8町に面している。
sen.e: Wakasa Bay faces 5 cities & 8 towns below.
Wakasa Bay faces 5 cities & 8 towns below.
Wakasa Bay faces five cities and eight towns below.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 越前岬から海岸線の到来順。
sen.e: They are in order from east to west along the coastline starting from Echizen-misaki Cape.
They are in order from east to west along the coastline starting from Echizen-misaki Cape.
They are in order along the coastline starting from Echizen-misaki Cape.
sen.cmt: from east は削除しました。

sen.j: 若狭湾には西端の丹後半島のほか、小規模な半島も多数見られる。
sen.e: On the coast facing Wakasa Bay, there exist Tango Peninsula (in its west end) & many other smaller peninsulas.
On the coast facing Wakasa Bay, there exist Tango Peninsula (in its west end) & many other smaller peninsulas.
On the coast facing Wakasa Bay, there exist Tango Peninsula (in its west end) and many other smaller peninsulas.

sen.j: 西から列挙すると、大浦半島 - 音海半島 - 大島半島 - 内外海半島 - 常神半島 - 敦賀半島、の順になっている。
sen.e: In order from west to east, they are Oura Peninsula, Otomi Peninsula, Oshima Peninsula, Uchitomi Peninsula, Tsunegami Peninsula and Tsuruga Peninsula.
In order from west to east, they are Oura Peninsula, Otomi Peninsula, Oshima Peninsula, Uchitomi Peninsula, Tsunegami Peninsula and Tsuruga Peninsula.
In order from west to east, they are Oura Peninsula, Otomi Peninsula, Oshima Peninsula, Uchitomi Peninsula, Tsunegami Peninsula and Tsuruga Peninsula.

sen.j: 風光明媚な景勝地が多く、常神半島腹部には三方五湖、内外海（うちとみ）半島には蘇洞門（そとも）、音海半島には音海断崖がある。
sen.e: They have many snenic spots, such as "Mikata-goko" (Five Lakes of Mikata) in the central part of Tsunegami Peninsula, "Sotomo" in Uchitomi Peninsula and Otomi Cliff in Otomi Peninsula.
They have many snenic spots, such as "Mikata-goko" (Five Lakes of Mikata) in the central part of Tsunegami Peninsula, "Sotomo" in Uchitomi Peninsula and Otomi Cliff in Otomi Peninsula.

sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 気象庁による海洋気象の海域区分として、「山陰沖東部および若狭湾付近」というものがある。
sen.e: As a division unit of the sea area set by Meteorological Office for indicating marine meteorology, there is "the eastern part off the coast of Sanin Region & the surrounding seas of Wakasa Bay."
As a division unit of the sea area set by Meteorological Office for indicating marine meteorology, there is "the eastern part off the coast of Sanin Region & the surrounding seas of Wakasa Bay."

sen.j: この範囲は福井県・京都府・鳥取県の沖、及び兵庫県の日本海沖、島根県の隠岐諸島周辺となっている。
sen.e: To be more exact, this means the sea area off the coast of Fukui, Kyoto and Tottori Prefecture, and the Sea of Japan off the coast of Hyogo Prefecture, and the surrounding seas of Oki Islands in Shimane Prefecture.
